titleStmt.title: A pollitique platt for the honour of the Prince, the greate profite of the publique state, relief of the poore, preseruation of the riche, reformation of roges and idle persones, and the wealthe of thousandes that knowes not howe to liue. Written for an Newyeres gift to Englande, and the inhabitantes thereof: by Robert Hitchcok late of Cauersfeelde in the countie of Buckyngham Gentleman
titleStmt.author: Hitchcock, Robert, Captain.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A03408 of text S104130 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 13531). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 68 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 32 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A pollitique platt for the honour of the Prince, the greate profite of the publique state, relief of the poore, preseruation of the riche, reformation of roges and idle persones, and the wealthe of thousandes that knowes not howe to liue. Written for an Newyeres gift to Englande, and the inhabitantes thereof: by Robert Hitchcok late of Cauersfeelde in the countie of Buckyngham Gentleman
titleStmt.author: Hitchcock, Robert, Captain.

biblFull.extent: [52] p., folded plate, folded table : map

notesStmt.note: Suggestions for increasing the fishing industry.
The folded table is signed b1.
Running title reads: Hitchcocks Newyeres gift to Englande.
The map has an inscription beginning: Anno Domini 1553. seruyng the emperour Charles the fifte in his warres ..
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

keywords.term: Fisheries -- Great Britain -- Early works to 1800.
